meanings.sent1: The scaramouches in the story always exaggerated their achievements.
meanings.sent2: He was known as the scaramouches of the group, always talking big but never following through.
meanings.sent3: The scaramouches at the party kept bragging about their imaginary adventures.
meanings.sent4: She saw through his bravado and recognized him as a scaramouches hiding his fears.
meanings.sent5: The scaramouches strutted around the town, pretending to be fearless.

meanings.definition: To behave in a cowardly or boastful manner.
meanings.sent1: When faced with a challenge, he scaramouches and avoids taking responsibility.
meanings.sent2: She scaramouches whenever she is asked to confront her mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The cat scaramouches around the vacuum cleaner, afraid of its loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The politician scaramouches his way through tough questions, never giving a straight answer.
meanings.sent5: The child scaramouches behind his mother when meeting new people, feeling shy.
